explanation: Chapter, Preface, Glossary, and Index are all distinct structural sections commonly found within a book. A Headline, while a textual component, is typically found in articles, newspapers, or magazines, rather than being a section within a book.

Hades (Greek), Osiris (Egyptian), Hel (Norse), and Pluto (Roman) are all prominent deities associated with the underworld or afterlife in their respective mythologies. Zeus is the king of the Olympian gods, associated with the sky and thunder, not the underworld.
All tokens except 'Gaze' are verbs describing a type of sound or the act of making a sound. 'Gaze' describes a way of looking intently (a visual action).
